title: How attractive is Percy Jackson? - Quora

response.answer_text: I hate to burst a lot of fangirls bubbles, but Percy isn’t really all that attractive. In the books he’s usually described as handsome, but not a head turner by any means. In Magnus Chase book III: Ship of the Dead the eponymous character even comments that he looked indistinguishable from your average 18–19 year old. If you want more proof, notice how Apollo never calls Percy hot or even comments on his being attractive, and every time Apollo sees someone particularly attractive he talks about it. Heck, he even comments about Meg (who’s like his sister) and Calypso’s (Whom he outright hates) attractiveness, but never Percy’s. Plus, Apollo also comments about attractive men as well as women. The only other times Percy’s supposed attractiveness is talked about in the entire series is when Hazel in The Son of Neptune says that he was good-looking, and once when Piper in the Mark of Athena comments that he’s cute. Neither of the cute or good-looking would make anyone think that hes some sort of super hot model that all these girls would fall for. They probably primarily liked him for his personality first. He’s nice heroic, brave, and funny. Who cares about looks when you have all that going for you. These are the primary reasons I have a problem with Percy’s new picture, by Viria.  Here he looks like some heart throb from an anime and not a regular teen/young adult. I personally believe that his original picture is much more true to the character.  Here he’s handsome, but not some teen heartthrob. He’s just you’re average guy, not ugly, but not hot either, good looking, is exactly the right way to describe him. DISCLAIMER: To be fair to Viria I think that she nailed every other character from the series. She drew them perfectly. Literally Percy was the only one I didn’t like, though granted, I REALLY didn’t like her version and he is kinda the main character. However, she captured everyone else’s likeness so well that it is clear that her strengths far outweigh her weaknesses.

He's good-looking, but don't you dare tell him I said that. ” –Annabeth Chase about Percy's appearance, in The Demigod Files interview Percy has a "Mediterranean" complexion. He has dishevelled, jet black hair swept to one side as “if he just got a walk to the beach” and sea-green eyes, which he inherited from his father and grandmother. He also has a sarcastic, troublemaker smile. Percy gets his handsome looks from his father, a reason why Medusa wanted to preserve a statue of him. He doesn't seem to know it or may simply refuse to acknowledge it, but a great number of girls find him extremely attractive. He was complimented by Calypso, who when asked whether she was in love with Percy states, "If you could see your face. Of course, you." At the beginning of the series, Percy was average in athletics but later from his training, becomes very fit, muscular, and lean. He obtained a gray streak of hair in The Titan's Curse from holding the sky but has since lost it, as stated in The Mark of Athena. After he slew Polybotes in The Son of Neptune, Percy received a tattoo of a trident and SPQR on the underside of his left arm to signify that he is a full member of the Roman Twelfth Legion Fulminata. After their reunion in The Mark of Athena, Annabeth says that Percy grew even more handsome, muscular, taller and that his lips are salty. Even Hazel stated that "[Percy] had the good looks of a Roman god." According to Piper in The Mark of Athena, Percy smells like the sea, looks like a skater and a troublemaker, but she can still see what women would like about him, even if he isn't her type. Piper later states that when Percy pleads, his sea-green eyes seemed to be "like a cute baby seal that needed help" and marvels at how Annabeth had ever won an argument with him. In The Hidden Oracle, the god Apollo is struck by Percy's close resemblance to his father Poseidon, noting that he had the same handsome features, "which easily shifted from humor to anger." He was noted to have long, nimble fingers, with Apollo claiming that Percy's hands were perfect for a musician. Ahem

Listen, let's just get this over with. There's lots of arguments about it so I pulled down all of the books from my bookshelves and I'll quote them verbatim and then you decide for yourself. Percy Jackson and the Demigod Files: Interview with Annabeth Chase, Daughter of Athena: “He's good-looking, but don't you dare tell him I said that.” (Why exactly would Annabeth lie?) Percy Jackson and the Battle of the Labyrinth: Chapter 12: I Take a Permanent Vacation: Quoting Calypso, who is an ethereally beautiful immortal Titan: “If you could see your face.” (Yeah, immortal Titans complement you as a joke, right) Heroes of Olympus: The Son of Neptune: Chapter V: Hazel: “He had the good looks of a Roman god" (A 13 year old girl compares someone to a Roman god, okay? A 13 year old. Also, mark that Hazel was actually born in 1928 and retains most of her old ways, which means Percy would be considered attractive even back then) Heroes of Olympus: The Mark of Athena: Chapter II: Annabeth: “His sea-green eyes were as gorgeous as she remembered. His dark hair was swept to one side, like he'd just come from a walk on the beach. He looked even better than he had six months ago- more tanned and taller, leaner and more muscular.” (Like sure she's his girlfriend, but you want me to believe a guy with THAT description isn't hot?) The Trials of Apollo: The Hidden Oracle: Chapter 3: Quoting Apollo, the paragon of manly beauty: “As usual, I was struck by his resemblance to his father, Poseidon. He had the same sea-green eyes, the same dark tousled hair, the same handsome features that could shift from humour to anger so easily.” (Apollo is the God of Truth, who cannot lie) So, if we've all carefully read the books, is it really so hard to believe that Percy Jackson is truly attractive? I mean, it's canon. Why is there even a question?

Alright kids, I’m taking these sources straight from Riordan wiki: Percy Jackson Percy is described as a pretty handsome guy, with disheveled, jet black hair, swept to one side as if he just gotten a walk to the beach and bright sea green eyes like his father Poseidon. He is described in a review as having a "Mediterranean" complexion. It is said that Percy gets his handsome looks from his father, Poseidon, a reason why Medusa wanted to preserve a statue of him in The Lightning Thief. He is also complimented by Calypso, who when asked whether she was in love with Percy states, "If you could see your face. Of course, you." Percy was noted to have long, nimble fingers in The Hidden Oracle, with Apollo claiming that Percy's hands were perfect for a musician. Hazel Levesque even stated in Son of Neptune that "He had the good looks of a Roman god." And really, being compared to a god is saying a lot. According to Piper in The Mark of Athena, Percy smells like the sea, looks like a skater and a troublemaker, but she can still see what women would like about him, even if he isn't her type. Piper later states that when Percy pleads, his sea-green eyes seemed to be "like a cute baby seal that needed help," and marvels at how Annabeth had ever won an argument with him. In The Hidden Oracle, the god Apollo is struck by Percy's close resemblance to his father Poseidon, noting that he had the same handsome features, "which easily shifted from humor to anger." Yeah. Percy is definitely attractive, to say the least.

“He's good-looking, but don't you dare tell him I said that.” -Annabeth Chase “Percy smiled at her - that sarcastic troublemaker smile that had annoyed her for years but eventually had become endearing. His sea-green eyes were as gorgeous as she remembered. His dark hair was swept to one side, like he'd just come from a walk on the beach. He looked even better than he had six months ago - tanner and taller, leaner and more muscular. Percy is described as a very handsome young man, with disheveled, jet black hair, swept to one side as if he just gotten a walk to the beach and bright sea-green eyes like his father Poseidon and grandmother Rhea. He is also described in a review as having a "Mediterranean" complexion. According to Piper in the Mark of Athena Percy smells like the sea, looks like a skater and a troublemaker, but she can still see what women would like about him, even if he isn't her type. Piper later states that when Percy pleads, his sea-green eyes seemed to be "like a cute baby seal that needed help," and marvels at how Annabeth had ever won an argument with him. In The Hidden Oracle, Apollo is struck by Percy's close resemblance to his father Poseidon, noting that he had the same handsome features, "which easily shifted from humor to anger." Percy is described to be really handsome by lots of characters, including Hazel (He has the good looks of a god), Calypso (If you could see your face), Reyna and even Nico, who had a crush on him before he met Will. However, I think Annabeth’s description of Percy’s handsome-ness may be a bit exaggerated- as he is her boyfriend after all.

I wrote this in a previous answer: Percy has "Mediterranean" complexion. He has disheveled, jet black hair swept to one side as “if he just gotten a walk to the beach” and sea-green eyes, which he inherited from his father and grandmother. He also has a sarcastic, troublemaker smile. Percy gets his handsome looks from his father, a reason why Medusa wanted to preserve a statue of him. He doesn't seem to know it or may simply refuse to acknowledge it, but a great number of girls find him extremely attractive. He was complimented by Calypso, who when asked whether she was in love with Percy states, "If you could see your face. Of course, you." At the beginning of the series, Percy was average in athletics but later from his training, becomes very fit, muscular, and lean. Also here is evidence from the books: Hazel, Son Of Neptune: He had the looks of a Roman God. Piper, Mark Of Athena: Percy smells like the sea, looks like a skater and a troublemaker, Piper later states that when Percy pleads, his sea-green eyes seemed to be "like a cute baby seal that needed help" and marvels at how Annabeth had ever won an argument with him. Apollo, Trials Of Apollo: Apollo is struck by Percy's close resemblance to his father Poseidon, noting that he had the same handsome features, "which easily shifted from humor to anger." He was noted to have long, nimble fingers, with Apollo claiming that Percy's hands were perfect for a musician. Annabeth, Demigod Files: He's good-looking, but don't you dare tell him I said that. Looks like this:   Hope this helped. Oh and before I went he most definitely does NOT look like this:

If we’re talking about physical attractiveness…. Not very. Now before everyone starts bashing me, let’s take a look at canon. It has been stated BY PERCY that he isn’t found attractive. I don’t quite recall which book (it was in the first series though), but he had just started at Goode, and the cheerleader welcoming him was like… “Hi, welcome to Goode!”And then Percy was like,She was smiling a really bright smile, but I could tell in her head she was like “ew who is this freak.” So we can assume he isn’t automatically attractive. Some of you might argue that Hazel thought he was a Roman god, but that was given the circumstances. He was carrying someone, who was probably at least a little heavy, through a river, he was all ripped up and torn apart, and of course, he has those eyes. So yeah.

Have a look at this:  Art by our goddess Viria, of course. Look at those vibrant green eyes! That sharp, magnificent jaw! That obviously well defined body! I'm not even interested in men, but Percy can make anyone question their sexuality. That is, of course, considering Viria’s art is the official Percy Jackson art. With the old official art, Percy looked like an egg. The teenager old official art Percy looked like a slightly less cringey egg. In fact, every character within the old official art looked like a somewhat spherical object with dubious facial features. And for some reason Nico had green eyes? Thank god those days are over and you can safely order one piping hot series of a good-looking Jackson, well-drawn and all. Praise to thee, Viria! <3

Okay, it’s probably already been mentioned, but Hazel said he had the looks of a Roman god. A Roman god. I don’t just think any old teenage boy would be mistaken for an immortal deity. Annd... he’s described as good-looking quite a few times. He does not seem to know it, or may simply refuse to acknowledge it, but a great number of girls (as well as Nico) find him extremely attractive. Even Hazel Levesque stated that "He had the good looks of a Roman god." He is also complimented by Calypso, who when asked whether she was in love with Percy states, "If you could see your face. Of course, you." I’m not saying he’s a the hottest heartthrob there is, or a guy with a fanclub of girls. I guess if you googled “hot people” you might as well find some everyday person with the same level of attractiveness. Like, there are people who aren’t ugly at all but they aren’t famous for being attractive. He’s one of them, I’d say. I mean, beauty’s in the eye of the beholder.

So, i’m a huge PJO fan and with no doubt, Percy Jackson is is good looking maybe not like Tom Cruise but handsome. If anyone can win Calypso’s heart (Especially when she’s trying her hardest not to fall in love) they have to have something in them. He even got Reyna to like him. According to Apollo, he has the same handsome features as his father (Posieden) . He gets Rachel Elizabeth Dare to like him and Annabeth Chase. I bet a bunch of people in CHB and Camp jupiter like him. If you think genetically, two people with good looks should have a kid with good looks as well. Posieden is of course handsome and Sally Jackson is also beautiful (Apollo said so himself and even wanted to flirt with her). I think that the picture by Viria is completely proper with the killer jawline and and mesmerizing sea green eyes.

Apparently super-freakin-godly-hot, seeing as we've seen a few girls fall for him. Now, I'm not into guys, but I can recognize when someones handsome (a lot of guys are too wimpy to admit it.)  Ahhh, I can already see myself falling for pre-pubescant Percy. But seriously, the new official art by Viria is so much better. This is one of Virias drawings of Percy:  Sea green eyes, messy black hair, tall, fit. Percy Jackson, everybody.

Don’t get confused with the fanart. That is how other fans perceive him. I mean, I love to imagine him as an attractive guy when I read the books, but he isn’t described as hot in the books. I feel that he is meant to look kinda cute. Not attractive to the point where people stop and stare, but he is definitely not ugly. Kinda cute as in his hair is little shaggy, his green eyes are charming, and his goofy grin can cause another person to easily smile back. I mean, he also got a few demigod girls to crush on him, as well as an immortal girl. So he’s got something going on.

Y'all need to stop using Calypso’s quote to determine whether Percy is handsome or not. She says that because he has a look of disbelief because he's shocked that someone like her could fall in love with him. But Percy is fairly attractive at the age of 16 because he grows into his looks. But before that he's fairly attractive. I think the “official” fandom art would be him at the end of the PJO series but before that he would've looked fairly average.

It really depends on your tastes. Based on how he is described in the books, he’s very average looking, slightly scrawny, but his personality is quite charming. . His physical resemblance to a Greek person from the Attica region is pretty evident if 1) you’re Greek and 2) his general description of pigmentation (olive skin, dark hair). I’ve always imagined him being a few inches under 6′, as demigods take after their mortal parents mostly, and his mother’s physical features suggest that her ancestors came from eastern Europe.

The discussion is probably over, but I will still say something. I would say he is handsome. He is described as good-looking by immortals and like a lot of people stated before, Hazel even said that he has the good looks of a Roman God. He has beautiful eyes, is probably fit and we know that he is around 6 feet tall. However, I wouldn't say that he is the reincarnation of Adonis or something and some fans are definitely exaggerating. Magnus described him as a normal looking guy and when Hazel compared him to a Roman God it was because of the situation too. It still is something tho…

I am a huge Percy Jackson fan. I love him! And judging by the number of girls that have fallen for him throughout the series, i’d say he is pretty HOT. Sea green eyes and messy black hair are the perfect combination in my opinion.

Apeareance Percy has disheveled jet-black hair, sea green eyes, a troublemaker smile, sometimes a brooding look, Mediterranean complexion, described as looking like a skater and a troublemaker, and has a wiry build. He should be handsome I guess. Rick is the only person who knows what he truly looks like.
Alright, this is the guy who played as Percy Jackson, ISN'T HE HOT? ( Logan Lerman)

He gets more attractive as the series goes on and he hits puberty and gets abs. At the very beginning Nancy calls him ugly and no one really disagrees, but several years later Hazel says he looks like a Greek god. Congrats, puberty! Your doin’ it right!

Well I wouldn’t say he is unattractive and certainly he has many, many, many, MANY fangirls (seconded only because of Leo Valdez and Nico di Angelo), but I don’t necessarily find him attractive to me personally, wether the portrayal is by Logan Lerman or Viria or the official artwork or somebody else or my own head. VIria’s Leo, though . . . mmm.
Obviously Percy is really attractive because kinzie and Reyna and annabeth all like him and calypso so you can see he is popular and handsome
